" 11. Conditions :- You are the second son of my parents. Due to the love I have for you and the desire to transfer the fixed property to you as per the schedule, I hereby give you, with all my heart, the property inherited from my ancestors Now, I, being in possession of the said property, having full rights of donation and sale, have transferred to me the following immovable property worth Rs. 2,70,000/- in words, free of charge and without any interest, and I have given it to you as per this settlement deed and have given it to you today. boundaries.boundaryS: Ft.54 Site belonging to Kumbhagiri Malyadri

sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 4787 of 2021, dated 26/Oct/2021, executed by Ganjam Malakondaiah, in favour of his Son, Ganjam Srinu, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 306 Sq. Yds. (or) 2754 Sq. Fts., comprised in survey number 120, situated in Naidupalem Village, Narsapuram Grama Panchayathi, Gudluru Mandal, within the District of Prakasam registered at sub-registrar office Singarayakonda(816) is bounded as follows: North by: Ft. 54 Panchayathi land South by: Ft.54 Site belonging to Kumbhagiri Malyadri East by: Ft.51 Site of Donor West by: Ft.51 Panchayathi Road

As per Registered Documents: 1. The Property comprised in survey number 120, situated in Naidupalem Village, admeasuring an extent of 306 Sq. Yds. (or) 2754 Sq. Fts., was Originally owned by Ganjam Malakondaiah, who acquired property through inheritance from his Ancestors. [Ref: Deed] 2. The aforementioned Ganjam Malakondaiah , executed a Gift Settlement Deed on 26/Oct/2021, registered as Document No.4787 of 2021, before the SRO Singarayakonda (816), in favour of his Son, Ganjam Srinu towards the property admeasuring an extent of 306 Sq. Yds. (or) 2754 Sq. Fts.,comprised in survey number 120, situated in Naidupalem Village.Schedule property is part of Gramakantam as per recitals of the deed. It is noted that online verification of the Encumbrance Certificate (EC) could not be carried out as the government website is currently non-operational. Consequently, verification of any existing active mortgage or lease deed could not be completed. Hence, F.I. is required to verify the EC prior to loan disbursement. (B) Additional Documents Supporting the Title : Note: It is to be noted that the HTR was not attached in this case, when the same is enquired with F.I., they reverted to release a conditional report. It is therefore advisable for F.I. to obtain HTR prior to the disbursement of the loan.
The  mutation proceedings were not concluded in the name of the current owner Ganjam Srinu.

sections.content: We have reviewed the documents provided to us as per the F.I policy and have concluded that the Ganjam Srinu, possesses a clear, valid, and marketable title to the property measuring 306 Sq. Yds. (or) 2754 Sq. Fts., comprised in survey number 120, situated in Naidupalem Village, Narsapuram Grama Panchayathi, Gudluru Mandal, within the District of Prakasam registered at sub-registrar office Singarayakonda(816).

Note:*We were unable to verify the online Encumbrance Certificate (EC) as the government website (https://registration.telangana.gov.in/EncumbranceSearch.htm) is currently not functional. Therefore, it is advised to verify the updated EC before the disbursement of the loan.
